intro: Ione angustipetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled owl's-eye, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has delicate, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. It belongs to the Polemoniaceae family and is known for its unique floral structure. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened and is protected in several states.
